ygData.subject: Re: Dragoon Dirk (off topic somewhat?)
ygData.msgSnippet: So what does this all have to do with being a Bard?  So far I have received about 40 messages from this list and maybe five of them were relevant.  If we keep
ygData.messageBody:
So what does this all have to do with being a Bard? So far I have
received about 40 messages from this list and maybe five of them were
relevant. If we keep mail-bombing the high level bards with this crap
they are not going to want to stay subscribed. Those are the guys that
can answer the most questions...

Kuvin (E'ci)

Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>
>
> Not braggadocio, just curious as to the earlier complaints of paying more
> than 20pp for a really good weapon. And frankly, killing orcs for that long
> is way boring and little or no xp at 12th level.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Elijah Meeker [mailto:elijah@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, June 16, 1999 2:54 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Dragoon Dirk (off topic somewhat?)
>
> From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>
>
> >Your group only rakes in 20pp in 2 hrs? Or is that 20pp each in those 2
> >hrs? If so then aren't you spending 20pp each to go get it at 60+ pp? If
> >not, what are you hunting? I can make 20pp in 4 hours by myself hunting
> >orcs, with 2 could easily do it in 2hrs.
>
> er, I believe it would be appropriate to include a discussion of level here.
> It of course looks like
> wanton and inane braggadocio to this 11th level bard *laughs* as would my
> claim of about 3-4 plat
> per hour soloing in Blackburrow (NOT that I think that is great, it's not a
> competition I have any
> need to enter not being a powergamer type) to a 1st level bard.
>
> Tszaaz
>
